relation: Not much. If you are of age there is Main Street and if you have a car there are many attractions a short car ride away.
Many options and all in all tastes good.
At least in my dorm, the dorms are not a close-knit community, but the rooms are big.
So far, my classes have not been challenging, but this semester may change my mind! I recommend J-Term for everyone! Easy 3 credit hours!
Meet people who stay on campus on the weekends, so that you are not bored. Participate in the Work and Learn Program!
I would give Lindenwood an overall grade of a C. Lindenwood is a pretty campus, but is a ghost town on the weekends. The student body is made up of mostly athletes and international students.

textAfterTable: Allison from St Peters, MO 12/29/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 7 out of 7 people found this review useful. 2 of 38 Categories Comments Great for these types of students ALL TYPES OF STUDENTS. THERE IS SUCH A VARIETY THERE! Tips for prospective students Talk to everyone you can in admissions to see what you can get for scholarships. They truly are there to help! Bang for the buck Everything has been pretty reasonable, and out of everywhere I applied they offered me the biggest scholarship. Am enjoying being here I really enjoy the smaller school feeling. I love how the campus is outside and the exercise you get just walking from class to class. I enjoy all of the people there. Everyone is friendly. I feel like the majority of the professors really care about how you're doing. Am learning a lot I
